page.title: 01SUMMARY OF STOER
page.content: This block is situated in the {North {West Highlands }of Scotland in the parish of Assynt.It includes the hamlets of Clashmore, Balchladich, Clashnessie, Culkein and Achnacarnin. The ground is hard and rocky, mostly covered in grass and heather. Few trees survive here because it is so windswept. There are mainly sheep reared here,and perhaps a few cows. On the southwest side of this peninsula the coast has dangerously steep cliffs and stoney beaches but on the opposite coastline there are some cliffs but also a very sandy beach popular with tourists. It is a very sparsely populated area and there are not many people left who speak the {Gaelic }language. Attempts to revive gaelic classes in Sutherland schools failed but classes are now starting in{Rhue Stoer Community Hall.
